Package rover

Class Logger

java.lang.Object
rover.Logger
class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
Output streams wrapper to help writing stuff in both the console and log files.
Author:
Antoine Stevan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) static long begin_time
    Reference time at which the logger has been opened, in nanoseconds.
    (package private) static java.text.DecimalFormat df
    To further format the time output in log files.
    (package private) static java.text.DateFormat format
    Date format for every logger used by the rover.
    (package private) java.io.BufferedWriter log
    The main feature of a logger is its ability to write in any log file.
    (package private) static java.io.BufferedWriter out
    A logger uses an standard output stream to print strings in the console directly.

  • Field Details

    • format

      static java.text.DateFormat format
      Date format for every logger used by the rover. In log files, there is a bit more informations than what is printed in the console, namely date and time. To do so with ease, let's define a static format for dates and times: DD/MM/YY, HH:MM:SS .. where '..' stands for either 'AM' or 'PM'.

    • df

      static java.text.DecimalFormat df
      To further format the time output in log files.

    • out

      static java.io.BufferedWriter out
      A logger uses an standard output stream to print strings in the console directly.

    • log

      java.io.BufferedWriter log
      The main feature of a logger is its ability to write in any log file.

    • begin_time

      static final long begin_time
      Reference time at which the logger has been opened, in nanoseconds.

  • Constructor Details

    • Logger

      Logger()

  • Method Details

    • give_date

      static java.lang.String give_date()
      Formating the date and time to have something more user friendly inside log files. When using the Date class with the static Logger format, some features of the resulting string are unwanted. This Logger method removes the trailing 'PM' or 'AM', removes the ',' in the middle and adds some brackets in front and behind date and time.
      Returns:
      a string of with following format '[SSS.MMM]'

    • open

      void open​(java.lang.String log_filename)
      Opens the log file output stream. By giving a log filename, the logger opens the wanted log file. If a FileNotFoundException is thrown during the opening process, an error message is printed but the execution continues.
      Parameters:
      log_filename - the name of the log file.

    • write

      void write​(java.lang.String str) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a string without a newline both in the console and in the log file (no auto flush).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be broadcasted.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.

    • write

      void write​(java.lang.String str, boolean newline) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a string with or without a newline both in the console and in the log file (no auto flush).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be broadcasted.
      newline - a boolean telling whether or not a new line is required.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.

    • writeln

      void writeln​(java.lang.String str) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes a string with a newline both in the console and in the log file (no auto flush).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be broadcasted.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.

    • print

      void print​(java.lang.String str)
      Prints a string without a newline both in the console and in the log file (auto flush).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be broadcasted.

    • println

      void println​(java.lang.String str)
      Prints a string with a newline both in the console and in the log file (auto flush).
      Parameters:
      str - the string to be broadcasted.

    • println

      void println​(int value)
      Prints a integer value with a newline both in the console and in the log file (auto flush).
      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to be broadcasted.

    • println

      void println​(lejos.robotics.navigation.Pose pose)
      Wrapper of the println(String) method to allow printing a Pose
      Parameters:
      pose - the pose to be broadcasted.

    • flush

      void flush() throws java.io.IOException
      Flushes the streams. Useful after a write method, which comes without autoflush.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.
      See Also:
      write(String), write(String, boolean), writeln(String)

    • close

      void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Closes the streams. Not to be forgotten after using such streams of data.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.IOException
      Main method to launch the rover in its environment.
      Parameters:
      args - java arguments for main methods.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong during flushing, an exception is thrown.
